block.p: Lisanne Skyler, a daughter of Rita D. Skyler and Martin L. Skyler of New York, is to be married this evening in Bryant Park to Kevin Andrew Justice Black, the son of Dr. Julia Schnebly-Black and Alastair MacDonald Black of Seattle. Rabbi Joel S. Goor will officiate.

Ms. Skyler, 30, who will keep her name, is a documentary filmmaker and feature film writer. She directed and was a co-writer of ''Getting to Know You,'' a film in which the bridegroom appeared. It was screened at the 1999 Sundance Film Festival. The bride graduated from the University of California at Berkeley and received a master's degree in cinema from San Francisco State University. Her father is a lawyer in New York. Her mother works with autistic children for the New York City Board of Education.

Lisanne Skyler, a daughter of Rita D. Skyler and Martin L. Skyler of New York, is to be married this evening in Bryant Park to Kevin Andrew Justice Black, the son of Dr. Julia Schnebly-Black and Alastair MacDonald Black of Seattle. Rabbi Joel S. Goor will officiate.

Ms. Skyler, 30, who will keep her name, is a documentary filmmaker and feature film writer. She directed and was a co-writer of ''Getting to Know You,'' a film in which the bridegroom appeared. It was screened at the 1999 Sundance Film Festival. The bride graduated from the University of California at Berkeley and received a master's degree in cinema from San Francisco State University. Her father is a lawyer in New York. Her mother works with autistic children for the New York City Board of Education.

Mr. Black, 38, is an actor in film and regional theater. He graduated from Carnegie Mellon University. His mother is a music and movement instructor in Seattle. His father retired from the Boeing Company, where he was an architect for buildings services, and is now an independent architect and regional planner in Seattle.
